rComments: The test are just like the homework. There will only be one problem on there that will be like something you havent seen. Go to TA sections most helpful thing. I managed to complete most of my homework there. It is very easy to fall behind and get confused the math is not hard just a lot of steps to memormize. Qi talks very fast and has an accent.

Differential Equations is generally one of the more difficult math courses, but Qi knows what he's talking about and does not overcomplicate the material. Lecture is useful, but not necessary to doing well. Qi posts all the topics covered on the course website. Don't procrastinate on the assignments, they are tedious and take a while to finish.
His accent is extremely hard to understand, lectures are barely helpful (I ended up learning more and better from reading the textbook). Tests are pretty easy, though.

Excellent teacher! Gives clear examples to the class, most of which are the exact format to the homework. Also incorporates real- world uses for the topics covered. Be sure to study the homeworks before tests, doing so will ensure you will do fine. Overall, very straight-forward class, topic is hard but Qi makes it very clear.

Gong is by far the best teacher suited to teach DE. His course is anything but a walk in the park but by the end of his course you will walk away a master in ODE's. He uses EE examples (he's an EE) that are difficult/complex but are actual applications in the real world. He flys through his lectures but there is structure to his course. Reccomend.

I found him intimidating. He's extremely intelligent to the point that the class is probably trivial and boring to him. There's one midterm, which I made the mistake of not studying for. But you have a chance to overwrite your whole grade with the final, which is easy if you study the material. He focuses on EE which is very useful and interesting.

This guy is probably the smartest/ most enthusiastic guy that you could take differential equations with. Apparently, he is too quick for some people, but I had no problem with his pace. Know your linear algebra!

This guy is epic. He is clear about his points, and the lectures are perfectly planned out. He is quick on his lecture, but that is not a problem because he answers questions. Just remember your linear algebra. You really can get alot out of him if you decide to.
Hard teacher, lectures hard to understand, goes through material fast, does custom homework, not from textbook. Overall bad experience

Not a very good teacher. Doesn't explain well and expects you to know everything you need to know. Not very helpful either. During office hours, I had a question and he told me if I read the book, which I did, I would've known the answer. Then again if I knew the answer, why the heck would I be at his office hours asking that question?
Great teacher, fair homework, fair tests, fair grading. Overall, I had a good experience in this class. I was well prepared for future classes needing this material.
Qi Gong is great. He explains things super clearly, and answers any question no matter how dumb it is. Class is difficult, but if you pay attention you'll be fine.

Hard to understand sometimes. Handwriting varies from lecture to lecture. Other than that, extremely helpful. You can tell he doesn't appreciate stupidity, but he tries his best to tolerate it and help students succeed. A real trooper.
